name: Victreebel

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

strengths: Lure forces opponent to switch in benched Pokemon
Can target and trap vulnerable Pokemon
Acid can prevent retreat for follow-up KO
Grass type is effective against Water Pokemon
weaknesses: 80 HP is low for a Stage 2
Stage 2 evolution is slow to set up
Acid's retreat prevention is coin-flip dependent
synergies: Pokemon with high damage attacks - Lure sets up KOs
Gust of Wind - similar switch effect
counters: Fire Pokemon - double damage from weakness
Pokemon with free retreat - immune to Acid's effect

competitiveHistory: Victreebel from Jungle was an interesting control option but saw limited competitive play. The Lure attack provided a Gust of Wind-like effect on a Pokemon, allowing players to drag up weak benched Pokemon for easy knockouts. However, the Stage 2 evolution requirement and low damage output made it too slow and weak for serious tournament play. Gust of Wind Trainer card was simply more efficient for the same effect.

rulings.ruling: Lure can only be used if your opponent has at least one Benched Pokemon.
Lure is not affected by effects that prevent switching (like Acid) since it forces the switch from your side.
Acid's retreat prevention lasts until the end of your opponent's next turn, even if Victreebel leaves play.
